question_text: With an instruction permit or Intermediate License, can you use a cell phone while driving?
explanation: Correct: No, not even hands‑free (emergency only). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: After 6 months of safe driving, how many passengers under 20 are allowed (not family)? (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: Up to 3. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.

question_text: How far must you park from a fire station driveway on the opposite side of the street?
explanation: Correct: 75 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: At what age can you take the knowledge exam without driver training?
explanation: Correct: After turning 15½. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: Which statement about transporting open alcohol or cannabis containers is TRUE?
answer_options: In the trunk or truck bed (not accessible to the driver)
explanation: Correct: In the trunk or truck bed (not accessible to the driver). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 Open container, line L46-L47.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 Open container, line L46-L47.

question_text: How far must you park from a traffic signal, stop sign, or yield sign?
explanation: Correct: 30 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: How far must you park from a driveway, alley, or private road?
explanation: Correct: 5 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: Typical safe speed range for a roundabout is:
explanation: Correct: 15–25 mph. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.

question_text: When turning left, you must yield to:
answer_options: Vehicles already stopped behind the line
explanation: Correct: Oncoming traffic, pedestrians, and bicyclists. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.

question_text: Regulatory speed limit signs are:
explanation: Correct: Vertical rectangles, black on white. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.

question_text: In a roundabout, you should:
answer_options: Always take the inside lane to exit
Yield to traffic already in the circle and enter at a safe gap
Stop before entering regardless of traffic
explanation: Correct: Yield to traffic already in the circle and enter at a safe gap. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.

question_text: Do not park within ___ of a traffic signal, stop sign, or yield sign.
explanation: Correct: 30 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: How far must you park from a traffic signal, stop sign, or yield sign?
explanation: Correct: 30 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: A flashing yellow 'X' over a lane means:
explanation: Correct: Lane is for turning only. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.

question_text: At an uncontrolled intersection, you must:
answer_options: Yield to traffic already in the intersection and to the right
explanation: Correct: Yield to traffic already in the intersection and to the right. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.

question_text: You see 'End Road Work' sign. Until then, you should:
answer_options: Ignore flaggers if no workers visible
Obey posted work-zone instructions and reduced speeds
explanation: Correct: Obey posted work-zone instructions and reduced speeds. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Work zone, lines L247-L249.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Work zone, lines L247-L249.

question_text: Knowledge exam scores are valid for (choose the best number)
answer_options: Until you pass the skills test
explanation: Correct: 2 years. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: Report a collision (if officer doesn't) within:
explanation: Correct: 4 days. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §5.9 Crashes & reporting, lines L324-L333.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §5.9 Crashes & reporting, lines L324-L333.

question_text: It is illegal in WA to drive while wearing:
answer_options: Headphones/earbuds broadcasting sound (except one-ear compliant hands‑free)
explanation: Correct: Headphones/earbuds broadcasting sound (except one-ear compliant hands‑free). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: Which statement about intersections is TRUE?
answer_options: Stop before entering regardless of traffic
Always take the inside lane to exit
Yield to traffic already in the circle and enter at a safe gap
explanation: Correct: Yield to traffic already in the circle and enter at a safe gap. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.

question_text: You should keep right except to:
explanation: Correct: Pass. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.

question_text: Warning signs (like 'Curve Ahead') are typically:
explanation: Correct: Diamond-shaped, yellow. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.

question_text: On Washington ocean beaches (Grays Harbor & Pacific counties), what is the speed limit?
explanation: Correct: 25 mph. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.20 Maritime (Ferries/Beaches), lines L269-L271.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.20 Maritime (Ferries/Beaches), lines L269-L271.

question_text: A shared center left-turn lane is used for:
answer_options: Left turns from either direction only (not for passing)
explanation: Correct: Left turns from either direction only (not for passing). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.

question_text: What is the minimum safe passing distance when overtaking a bicyclist? (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 3 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.

question_text: Approaching emergency vehicles with flashing lights at roadside, you must:
answer_options: Move over or slow ≥10 mph below the limit (max 50 mph)
explanation: Correct: Move over or slow ≥10 mph below the limit (max 50 mph). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Emergency zone, lines L250-L251.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Emergency zone, lines L250-L251.

question_text: It can take a train up to ____ to stop.
explanation: Correct: a mile. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.

question_text: A YIELD sign is shaped like a:
explanation: Correct: Triangle (point down). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11-4.12 Signs & Signals, lines L193-L205.

question_text: A shared center left-turn lane is for:
answer_options: Left turns from either direction only (not for passing)
explanation: Correct: Left turns from either direction only (not for passing). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.

question_text: In an emergency zone with flashing lights ahead, you must (choose the best number)
answer_options: Move over or slow at least 10 mph below the limit (max 50 mph)
Maintain speed but turn on hazards
explanation: Correct: Move over or slow at least 10 mph below the limit (max 50 mph). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Emergency zone, lines L250-L251.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Emergency zone, lines L250-L251.

question_text: You must dim high beams when an oncoming vehicle is within:
explanation: Correct: 500 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: A steady red 'X' over a lane means:
answer_options: Do not drive in this lane
explanation: Correct: Do not drive in this lane. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.10-4.11/4.16 Road markings, lines L231-L236, L234.

question_text: Without driver training, when can you take the knowledge exam for a permit? (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: After turning 15½. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: You must switch from high beams to low beams when an oncoming vehicle is within:
explanation: Correct: 500 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: Refusing a chemical test under Implied Consent may suspend your license for:
answer_options: 90 to 730 days (or until age 21, whichever is longer)
explanation: Correct: 90 to 730 days (or until age 21, whichever is longer). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.

question_text: At a railroad crossing, stop ___ from the nearest rail when required.
explanation: Correct: 50 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: For drivers 21+, DUI per se BAC is:
explanation: Correct: 0.08% or higher. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.

question_text: At a railroad crossing with flashing lights, how far from the nearest rail must you stop?
explanation: Correct: Between 15 and 50 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.

question_text: A round, yellow sign with an 'X' indicates:

question_text: Do not park within ___ of a fire hydrant.

source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: A steady green arrow over a lane means:

question_text: At intersections, pedestrians have right-of-way:

Only when a walk signal shows

question_text: What is the school-zone speed limit unless otherwise posted?

source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Zones, lines L246-L251.

question_text: You're using high beams at night. When must you dim them for oncoming traffic?
explanation: Correct: 500 feet. You must dim high beams when within 500 feet of oncoming traffic (and 300 feet when following another vehicle). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: At a four-way stop, who goes first?

answer_options: Working brake & signal lights, seat belts, and proof of liability insurance

source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.12 Exams, lines L32-L34.

question_text: Dim high beams for oncoming vehicles within ___.
explanation: Correct: 500 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: On Washington ocean beaches (Grays Harbor & Pacific counties), the speed limit is:
explanation: Correct: 25 mph. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.20 Maritime (Ferries/Beaches), lines L269-L271.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.20 Maritime (Ferries/Beaches), lines L269-L271.

question_text: For 16–17 licensing you must log at least:
explanation: Correct: 40 hours day + 10 hours night (50 total). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: For 16–17 licensing you must log at least (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 40 hours day + 10 hours night (50 total). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: Report a collision (if officer doesn't) within (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 4 days. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §5.9 Crashes & reporting, lines L324-L333.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §5.9 Crashes & reporting, lines L324-L333.

question_text: Open container/cannabis law allows transport only:
answer_options: In the trunk or truck bed (not accessible to the driver)
explanation: Correct: In the trunk or truck bed (not accessible to the driver). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 Open container, line L46-L47.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 Open container, line L46-L47.

question_text: Dim high beams when following another vehicle within ___.
explanation: Correct: 300 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: In Washington, may a bicyclist use the full lane?
answer_options: Yes, bicyclists may use the full lane
No, they must stay far right at all times
explanation: Correct: Yes, bicyclists may use the full lane. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.

question_text: Refusing a chemical test under Implied Consent may suspend your license for:
answer_options: 90 to 730 days (or until age 21, whichever is longer)
explanation: Correct: 90 to 730 days (or until age 21, whichever is longer). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.

question_text: Transporting an animal in a truck bed is legal only if:
answer_options: The animal is in a protective harness or enclosure
explanation: Correct: The animal is in a protective harness or enclosure. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.19 Transporting/Animals, lines L266-L268.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.19 Transporting/Animals, lines L266-L268.

question_text: Fines in construction work zones are:
explanation: Correct: Doubled when workers are present. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Work zone, lines L247-L249.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Work zone, lines L247-L249.

question_text: Are carpool (HOV) lanes passing lanes?
answer_options: No, HOV lanes are not passing lanes
explanation: Correct: No, HOV lanes are not passing lanes. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.16 Lane Use, lines L238-L242.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.16 Lane Use, lines L238-L242.

question_text: Children ages 4+ must use a car/booster seat until (choose the best number)
answer_options: Seat belts fit properly (typically up to 4'9" or ages 8–12)
explanation: Correct: Seat belts fit properly (typically up to 4'9" or ages 8–12). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.6 Occupant protection, lines L77-L82.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.6 Occupant protection, lines L77-L82.

question_text: On Washington ocean beaches (Grays Harbor & Pacific counties), the speed limit is (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 25 mph. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.20 Maritime (Ferries/Beaches), lines L269-L271.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.20 Maritime (Ferries/Beaches), lines L269-L271.

question_text: Transporting an animal in a truck bed is legal only if:
answer_options: The animal is in a protective harness or enclosure
explanation: Correct: The animal is in a protective harness or enclosure. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.19 Transporting/Animals, lines L266-L268.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.19 Transporting/Animals, lines L266-L268.

question_text: Second violation under Intermediate License results in:
answer_options: 6-month suspension or until age 18 (whichever comes first)
explanation: Correct: 6-month suspension or until age 18 (whichever comes first). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.

question_text: With an Intermediate License, nighttime driving (1–5 a.m.) is:
answer_options: Allowed if the roads are empty
Not allowed unless with a parent/guardian or 25+ licensed driver
explanation: Correct: Not allowed unless with a parent/guardian or 25+ licensed driver. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.

question_text: Lights begin flashing at a railroad crossing as you approach. Where should you stop?
explanation: Correct: Between 15 and 50 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.

question_text: How far must you park from pedestrian safety zones?
explanation: Correct: 20 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: Typical safe speed range for a roundabout is (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 15–25 mph. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.14-4.15 Intersections/Roundabouts, lines L212-L224.

question_text: Fines in construction areas are:
explanation: Correct: Doubled when workers are present. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Work zone, lines L247-L249.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.17 Work zone, lines L247-L249.

question_text: Children ages 2–4 must ride in:
answer_options: A car seat with a harness (rear- or forward-facing)
explanation: Correct: A car seat with a harness (rear- or forward-facing). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.6 Occupant protection, lines L77-L82.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.6 Occupant protection, lines L77-L82.

question_text: For drivers under 21, BAC that triggers DUI consequences is (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 0.02% or higher. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.

question_text: Headlights must be on from:
answer_options: ½ hour after sunset to ½ hour before sunrise (and when conditions require)
explanation: Correct: ½ hour after sunset to ½ hour before sunrise (and when conditions require). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: On a two-lane road, when may you pass a bicyclist?
answer_options: When you can fully move into the oncoming lane with no oncoming traffic
By squeezing past in the same lane
Only if the bicyclist signals you to pass
explanation: Correct: When you can fully move into the oncoming lane with no oncoming traffic. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.

question_text: It is a crime to leave a child unattended in a parked vehicle when
answer_options: Under 16 with engine running; under 12 regardless
explanation: Correct: Under 16 with engine running; under 12 regardless. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking safety, lines L255-L257.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking safety, lines L255-L257.

question_text: Washington Instruction Permit is valid for (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 1 year (renewable with fee). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: When an emergency vehicle approaches with lights/sirens:
answer_options: Pull to the right and stop
explanation: Correct: Pull to the right and stop. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.9 Emergency vehicles, lines L189-L190.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.9 Emergency vehicles, lines L189-L190.

question_text: How far must you park from a fire hydrant?
explanation: Correct: 15 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: What is the minimum safe passing distance when overtaking a bicyclist?
explanation: Correct: 3 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.6 Bicyclists, lines L178-L182.

question_text: You must dim high beams when following another vehicle within:
explanation: Correct: 300 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: Children up to age 2 must ride in:
answer_options: A front seat with seat belt only
explanation: Correct: A rear-facing car seat. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.6 Occupant protection, lines L77-L82.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.6 Occupant protection, lines L77-L82.

question_text: Knowledge exam scores are valid for:
answer_options: Until you pass the skills test
explanation: Correct: 2 years. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: Vehicle used for the skills exam must have:
answer_options: Working brake & signal lights, seat belts, and proof of liability insurance
explanation: Correct: Working brake & signal lights, seat belts, and proof of liability insurance. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.12 Exams, lines L32-L34.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.12 Exams, lines L32-L34.

question_text: For drivers under 21, BAC that triggers DUI consequences is:
explanation: Correct: 0.02% or higher. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.

question_text: Without driver training, when can you take the knowledge exam for a permit?
explanation: Correct: After turning 15½. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: Washington Instruction Permit is valid for:
explanation: Correct: 1 year (renewable with fee). Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: You must switch from high beams to low beams when an oncoming vehicle is within (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 500 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §2.5 Vehicle lights, lines L71-L75.

question_text: How far from pedestrian safety zones must you avoid parking?
explanation: Correct: 20 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.18 Parking, lines L252-L256.

question_text: When a school bus has red lights flashing and the stop arm extended on a two-lane road, you must:
answer_options: Stop only if you're behind the bus
explanation: Correct: Stop in both directions. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.2 School buses, lines L165-L168.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.2 School buses, lines L165-L168.

question_text: Before proceeding, you must wait for a pedestrian to clear:
answer_options: Your lane and one additional lane
explanation: Correct: Your lane and one additional lane. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.1 Sharing with people, lines L162-L164.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.1 Sharing with people, lines L162-L164.

question_text: Earliest age to get an Instruction Permit when enrolled in driver training (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 15 years. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: For drivers 21+, DUI per se THC is (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: 5.0 ng/mL or higher. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.15 DUI & Implied Consent, lines L42-L46.

question_text: At a railroad crossing with flashing lights, how far from the nearest rail must you stop? (choose the best number)
explanation: Correct: Between 15 and 50 feet. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.7 Trains, lines L183-L186.

question_text: After 6 months of safe driving, how many passengers under 20 are allowed (not family)?
explanation: Correct: Up to 3. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8-1.9 Intermediate License, lines L21-L24.

question_text: Automated traffic safety cameras in WA may issue tickets for:
answer_options: Red-light, railroad signal, and school-zone speed violations
explanation: Correct: Red-light, railroad signal, and school-zone speed violations. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11 Regulatory signs, lines L202-L205.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §4.11 Regulatory signs, lines L202-L205.

question_text: Earliest age to get an Instruction Permit when enrolled in driver training:
explanation: Correct: 15 years. Source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.
source: WA DOL Driver Guide (plain-text) §1.8 Instruction permits, lines L12-L19.

question_text: What is the default speed limit on city and town streets in Washington (unless otherwise posted)?
explanation: City/town default is 25 mph unless otherwise posted.
source: RCW 46.61.400/.405 (default limits 25/50/60) — via Adams County FAQ

question_text: On county roads in Washington, the default speed limit (unless posted otherwise) is:
explanation: County roads default to 50 mph unless otherwise posted.
source: RCW 46.61.400/.405 (default limits 25/50/60) — via Adams County FAQ

question_text: On Washington state highways, the default speed limit (unless otherwise posted) is:
explanation: State highways default to 60 mph unless otherwise posted.
source: RCW 46.61.400/.405 (default limits 25/50/60) — via Adams County FAQ

question_text: You can be cited in WA for driving too fast for conditions even if under the posted limit. This is:
explanation: WA enforces a basic speed law: adjust speed for conditions.
source: WA Driver Guide & RCW 46.61.400

question_text: What is the correct hand signal for a right turn?
explanation: Right turn: left arm up (or use signal lamps).
source: RCW 46.61.310 (hand/arm signals) — app.leg.wa.gov

question_text: What is the correct hand signal for slowing or stopping?
explanation: Slow/stop: left arm down.
source: RCW 46.61.310 (hand/arm signals) — app.leg.wa.gov

question_text: If your signal lamps fail, Washington law allows you to:
explanation: RCW allows hand/arm signals when lamps are unavailable.
source: RCW 46.61.310 (hand/arm signals) — app.leg.wa.gov

question_text: Headlights in Washington must be used from:
answer_options: Half an hour after sunset to half an hour before sunrise, or when visibility < 1,000 ft
Only in rural areas at night
explanation: RCW 46.37.020 requires lights from 30 min after sunset to 30 min before sunrise and when visibility is under 1,000 ft.
source: RCW 46.37.020 (headlights timing) — app.leg.wa.gov

question_text: When must you dim high beams for an oncoming vehicle in WA?
explanation: Dim for oncoming within 500 ft; for following within 300 ft.
source: WA Driver Guide; RCW 46.37.230 summary

question_text: When following another vehicle, you must dim high beams when you are within:
explanation: Dim high beams within 300 ft when following.
source: WA Driver Guide; RCW 46.37.230 summary

question_text: At approximately what speed can many vehicles begin to hydroplane on standing water?
explanation: Risk of hydroplaning can begin around ~35 mph on standing water.
source: Hydroplaning ~35 mph risk — carparts.com/blog

question_text: What is the common minimum legal tread depth for most passenger tires?
explanation: 2/32" is the typical minimum tread depth; replace before this.
source: WA tire law/tread depth context — legalclarity.org; KOMO/AAA maintenance piece

question_text: To reduce hydroplaning risk, you should:
answer_options: Increase speed to cut through water
Drive in tracks of vehicles ahead and reduce speed
explanation: Slow down, maintain good tread, and drive in existing tracks.
source: Hydroplaning ~35 mph risk — carparts.com/blog

question_text: When parking uphill with a curb, turn the front wheels:
explanation: Uphill with curb: turn wheels away so the curb catches the tire.
source: Hill parking general rules — driversprep.com / thewisedrive.com

question_text: When parking downhill with a curb, turn the front wheels:
explanation: Downhill with curb: turn wheels toward the curb.
source: Hill parking general rules — driversprep.com / thewisedrive.com

question_text: When parking uphill with NO curb, turn the front wheels:
explanation: No curb: steer toward the road edge so the car rolls away from traffic.
source: Hill parking general rules — driversprep.com / thewisedrive.com

question_text: At speeds above 30 mph, a good following distance in WA is at least:
explanation: Use at least the four‑second rule at higher speeds.
source: WA practice references; Quizlet note to Driver Guide

question_text: In ideal conditions under 30 mph, what is the minimum following distance guideline?
explanation: Two‑second rule in lighter, slower conditions; increase as needed.
source: WA Driver Guide common practice

question_text: In Washington, after stopping at a red light, you may turn right:
answer_options: Only if a police officer directs you
If there is no sign prohibiting it and it’s safe
explanation: Right on red is allowed after a complete stop unless posted otherwise.
source: WA Driver Guide; WMST PDF

question_text: In Washington, after stopping at a red light, when may you turn LEFT on red?
answer_options: Only from a one‑way street onto another one‑way street when allowed and safe
explanation: Left on red is permitted from one‑way to one‑way after stop when not prohibited.
source: WA Driver Guide; WMST PDF

question_text: A pennant‑shaped yellow sign indicates:
explanation: Pennant (sideways triangle) marks the start of a no‑passing zone.
source: WA signs references

question_text: An orange diamond sign generally means:
explanation: Orange diamonds warn of construction/work zones.
source: WA signs references

question_text: A red triangle with a reflective border affixed to a vehicle indicates:
explanation: Slow-moving vehicle emblem.
source: WA signs references

question_text: When following a motorcycle, you should use at least:
explanation: Increase following distance; motorcycles can stop quickly.
source: Common WA practice/Driver Guide

question_text: If you cannot see a truck’s mirrors, the truck driver:
answer_options: Can still see you with cameras
explanation: If you can’t see the mirrors, they probably can’t see you.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: Unless otherwise posted, the school‑zone speed limit in WA is:
explanation: School zones are typically 20 mph.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: On a roadway with three or more lanes in each direction, when a school bus stops with red lights flashing, oncoming traffic must:
explanation: Opposite-direction traffic on 3+ lanes or divided highway is not required to stop.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: In Washington emergency zones, you must either move over or:
answer_options: Maintain speed if in your lane
Slow at least 10 mph below the limit (never over 50 mph)
explanation: WA emergency‑zone rule: slow 10 mph below limit, max 50 mph.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: Automated cameras in WA may cite for:
answer_options: Red‑light, railroad signal, and school‑zone speed violations
explanation: Cameras enforce red lights, RR signals, school‑zone speed.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: For drivers age 21+, Washington’s per se limit for blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
explanation: BAC ≥ 0.08% is DUI per se for 21+.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: For drivers age 21+, Washington’s per se THC concentration is:
explanation: THC ≥ 5 ng/mL is DUI per se for 21+.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: Under 21, a BAC of ____ can result in DUI consequences in WA.
explanation: Under 21: 0.02% or higher triggers DUI consequences.
source: WA Driver Guide

question_text: Using the penny test, if you can see the top of Lincoln’s head, your tread is:
explanation: Seeing Lincoln’s head means tread is too low.
source: WA tire law/tread depth context — legalclarity.org; KOMO/AAA maintenance piece

question_text: The safest way to handle a curve is to:
answer_options: Brake in the middle of the curve
Brake before the curve, then accelerate gently through
explanation: Slow before entering, then accelerate gently to maintain control.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: In fog, you should use:
explanation: Use low beams; high beams reflect glare in fog.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: On wet roads, your following distance should be:
explanation: Increase following distance in rain/wet conditions.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If your vehicle starts to skid, you should:
answer_options: Steer in the direction you want the front wheels to go
explanation: Look/steer where you want to go; ease off pedals.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If your brakes fail, your first action should be to:
answer_options: Pump the brake pedal to build pressure
explanation: Pump brakes; downshift; use parking brake if needed.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: With ABS (anti-lock brakes) during emergency braking, you should:
explanation: With ABS, press firmly and steer around hazards.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: When entering a freeway, you should:
answer_options: Stop at the end of the ramp
Match speed with traffic in the acceleration lane and merge when safe
Drive on the shoulder until a gap opens
Enter at any speed if signaling
explanation: Use the acceleration lane to match speed and merge.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If you miss your freeway exit, you should:
answer_options: Stop and wait for a gap
Cross the median to turn around
explanation: Proceed to the next exit; never back up or cross medians.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Ramp meters displaying a red light mean:
answer_options: You must stop at the stop line until green
explanation: Stop at ramp meters when red until green signal.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: It is illegal to shift gears while crossing railroad tracks because:
answer_options: You might stall on the tracks
explanation: Avoid shifting on tracks to reduce stall risk.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Always look and listen for trains even if warning signals are not active because:
answer_options: Signals can malfunction or a second train may be approaching
explanation: Never rely solely on signals; look and listen.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: In a roundabout, do not stop in the circle unless:
answer_options: There is a collision or emergency
You want to yield to vehicles entering
explanation: Keep moving; stop only for emergencies.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Before exiting a roundabout, you should:
explanation: Signal right to exit a roundabout.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: When an emergency vehicle with lights and siren approaches, you must:
answer_options: Pull to the right edge and stop
explanation: Pull right and stop until it passes.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: At night, you should dim your high beams when following within 300 ft because:
answer_options: It reduces glare for the driver ahead
It makes signs easier to read
explanation: Prevent glare in the mirrors of the vehicle ahead.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: At an unmarked crosswalk, you must:
explanation: Every intersection is a crosswalk; yield appropriately.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You must signal at least ____ before turning or changing lanes.
explanation: Signal at least 100 ft before turns/lane changes.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Before turning left across oncoming traffic, you should:
answer_options: Yield and turn only when there is a safe gap
Stop in the intersection to wait
explanation: Yield to oncoming traffic and turn when safe.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Before passing on a two‑lane road, you must ensure that:
answer_options: It’s a dotted yellow on your side and you have a clear view ahead
You are in a no‑passing zone
explanation: Only pass with a dashed yellow on your side and a clear path.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You may not pass within:
answer_options: 100 ft of a bridge or tunnel
100 ft of an intersection or railroad crossing
explanation: Do not pass near intersections or RR crossings.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Texting while driving in WA is:
explanation: Hand‑held use is prohibited; enforcement is primary.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Seat belts in WA must be worn by:
explanation: All occupants must wear seat belts; child restraints as required.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Stopping distance is the sum of:
explanation: Perception/reaction + braking = stopping distance.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: In a work zone, you must obey the instructions of:
answer_options: No one if no workers are visible
explanation: Obey flaggers and signs; fines may double.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and:
answer_options: Glance over your shoulder to check blind spots
explanation: A quick shoulder check covers blind spots.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: When backing, you should:
answer_options: Turn your head and look through the rear window
explanation: Look through rear window while backing; go slowly.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You must remain stopped for a school bus with red lights until:
answer_options: The lights stop flashing and the stop sign is retracted
explanation: Remain stopped until signals are off and stop arm retracts.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: A “stale green” light is:
explanation: Be ready to stop; a stale green may change soon.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: In heavy rain during the day, you should use:
explanation: Use low beams to increase visibility to others.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You may drive on the shoulder:
answer_options: Only when directed by signs or officials
explanation: Shoulders are not travel lanes unless signed or directed.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: On multi‑lane roads in WA, the left lane is generally for:
explanation: Keep right, pass left; follow lane‑use signs where posted.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You must obey directions from school crossing guards:
answer_options: At all times when they are on duty
explanation: Crossing guards’ instructions are enforceable.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: When turning right across a bike lane, you should:
answer_options: Merge into the bike lane if allowed and then turn when clear
Turn from the travel lane across the bike lane without merging
Stop in the bike lane to wait
explanation: Yield to bicyclists; merge into the lane where permitted before turning.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If your vehicle is disabled on the shoulder at night, you should:
answer_options: Turn off all lights to save battery
Leave headlights off but hazards on
Use hazard flashers and, if available, reflective triangles/flares
Stand in front of the vehicle to wave traffic
explanation: Make your vehicle visible and stay clear of traffic.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: When passing a bicyclist, you should allow at least:
explanation: Leave a safe buffer—at least 3 feet is recommended.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You may be cited for driving significantly below the speed of traffic when:
answer_options: You are in the right lane
You impede normal and reasonable movement of traffic
You are looking for an address
explanation: Don’t impede traffic; use right lane and safe pull‑offs.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Before making a U‑turn, you must ensure that:
answer_options: You can complete it without interfering with other traffic and where allowed
explanation: Only make U‑turns where legal and safe.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If another driver displays road rage, you should:
answer_options: Don’t engage; create space and avoid eye contact
explanation: De‑escalate by increasing space and avoiding confrontation.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Properly adjusted head restraints help prevent:
explanation: Head restraints reduce whiplash risk.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If your car breaks down on the highway, you should place reflective triangles or flares:
explanation: Place warning devices 100–200 ft behind to alert approaching traffic.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: In a WA work zone, whose directions take priority?
explanation: Always obey flaggers first, even over signals.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: If your vehicle stalls on a freeway, you should:
answer_options: Stay in the lane and wait
Move to the shoulder if possible, turn on hazards, stay inside with seatbelt
Stand behind the car to warn traffic
explanation: Move to shoulder, turn on hazards, remain belted inside until help arrives.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: On WA ocean beaches open to driving, the maximum speed limit is:
explanation: Beach driving limit is 25 mph unless otherwise posted.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: When boarding a Washington State Ferry by car, you must:
answer_options: Turn off your headlights and follow crew directions
Stay in gear and ready to move
Drive at highway speeds onto the ferry
explanation: Obey crew, turn off headlights, and park as directed.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
answer_options: You may pass if no traffic is visible
explanation: Solid yellow on your side = no passing.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: WA law requires headlights to be on whenever:
explanation: Headlights must be used whenever wipers are on for rain/snow.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: Parking is prohibited:
explanation: Do not park on sidewalks, in front of driveways, or within intersections.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)

question_text: You must stop for railroad tracks when:
explanation: Stop when lights flash, gate lowered, or flagger signals.
source: Washington Driver Guide (current)
